principles.title: Clarity Over Verbosity
principles.description: Use precise language that conveys exact meaning without unnecessary words.

examples.before: I would like you to carefully analyze the following dataset.

principles.title: Structure for Efficiency
principles.description: Use consistent formatting to organize information hierarchically.

examples.before: First, I want you to summarize the main points. After that, I would like you to highlight the key findings. Finally, conclude with recommendations.
examples.after:
1. Summarize main points
2. Highlight key findings
3. Provide recommendations

principles.title: Command-Based Direction
principles.description: Use imperative verbs to give direct instructions.

examples.before: You should analyze the data and then provide insights.

principles.title: Functional Minimalism
principles.description: Include only what changes AI behavior, removing decorative language.

examples.before: Please be sure to provide a comprehensive and detailed analysis of the text.

principles.title: Demonstrate, Don't Explain
principles.description: Show the desired output format rather than describing it.

examples.before: I want you to create a list of three bullet points that summarize the main ideas.

techniques.name: Active Voice
techniques.description: Use active rather than passive constructions
techniques.example: 'Analyze the data' vs. 'The data should be analyzed'

techniques.name: Direct Address
techniques.example: 'Summarize in three points' vs. 'You should provide a summary in three points'

techniques.name: Parallel Structure
techniques.description: Use consistent grammatical forms for series of items

techniques.name: Chunking
techniques.example: Group all formatting instructions in one section

techniques.name: Eliminate Redundancy
techniques.example: State a rule once instead of restating it multiple ways

techniques.name: Cut Hedge Words
techniques.example: 'Analyze this' vs. 'Perhaps you could analyze this'

techniques.name: Trim Excessive Politeness
techniques.example: 'Please analyze' vs. 'Please, if you would be so kind, analyze'

examples.title: Data Analysis Request
examples.before: I would like you to carefully analyze the following dataset that I'm providing to you. Please make sure to look at all the trends and patterns in the data, and then provide me with a comprehensive summary of your findings. Also, please include any interesting anomalies that you might discover in the data.
examples.after:
Analyze this dataset:
1. Identify key trends
2. Summarize patterns
3. Note anomalies

examples.title: Content Creation
examples.before: I need you to write me a professional and engaging email that I can send to potential clients about our new product launch. The email should be friendly yet professional in tone, and it should highlight the main benefits of our product while also encouraging the recipients to take action by clicking on a link to learn more.
examples.after:
Draft a product launch email:
- Professional, engaging tone
- Highlight: [key benefit 1], [benefit 2]
- Include call-to-action link
- Length: 3-4 paragraphs
